title: Lendy investors set for £11m payout but face anxious wait for more cash
text:
Investors in the failed peer-to-peer platform Lendy are set to win back just £11m of the £152m they collectively invested and face a nervous wait to see if more of their money will be recovered.

Lendy fell into administration in May, leaving its 20,000 customers in limbo, some of whom had invested six-figure sums. Investors have been unable to withdraw cash from the platform for the past four months, even in cases where the borrower has fully repaid their loan.

The administrators appointed to oversee Lendy’s wind-down, RSM, have promised investors that about £11m of cash has been freed up and can be withdrawn shortly.

The platform will re-open in the next 21 days to facilitate these payments,...
